body_html: @braingineer Using where or switch won't work in this situation because you might have inputs that are zero but shouldn't be masked, since the mask is also applied to the incoming gradient. Masking should only happen in specified positions, which, one way or another, requires a list of lengths.

body: @braingineer Using `where` or `switch` won't work in this situation because you might have inputs that are zero but shouldn't be masked, since the mask is also applied to the incoming gradient.  Masking should only happen in specified positions, which, one way or another, requires a list of lengths.
